passages.text: FY25 Result - Earnings but net cash in line; \(\) 10.50\(/sh PT, retain\) \text {Neutral} \(\)

Key takeaways from the FY25 result: 1) EBITDA/NPAT misses of \(10\% /12\%\) to consensus were primarily driven by higher costs, 2) Net debt was broadly in line with JPMc/Cons, and 3) there were no changes to guidance provided with updates on the Karlawinda Expansion Project provided yesterday, highlighting good progress with first gold still targeted for SepQ26, and updates on schedule and capex still expected early DecQ. The growth outlook for CMM is the strongest in our coverage as KEP and Mt Gibson advance \((+26\%\) CAGR to FY29), but FCF is softer vs peers as a result ( \(1\%\) FY26/FY27 avg). Our PT moves marginally higher to \(\) 10.50\(/sh, but we retain our Neutral rating.\)

- NPAT/EBITDA miss on costs; no major project updates as KEP advances towards early DecQ update. EBITDA of A\$273m was a \(13\% /10\%\) miss to JPMc/Cons and NPAT of A\$150m was a \(11\% /12\%\) miss to JPMc/Cons, both primarily due to higher costs ( \(\sim\) 530m higher than JPMc/Cons). Net debt was broadly in line with JPMc/Cons. There were no changes to the guidance provided in the JunQ, and no updates on progress for Mt Gibson permitting. CMM provided an update on the Karlawinda Expansion Project (KEP) yesterday, as early works continue and siteworks kick off. Construction activities are progressing as follows: accommodation village operational, plant site earthworks underway, KEP stores complete, concrete contractor mobilised, concrete batch plant commissioned, boxcut into the Bibra pit underway; mining commenced at Berwick pit, clearing & grubbing TSF 2 ongoing, process plant design \(75\%\) complete, and ball mill purchased for arrival in JunQ26. Commissioning of the ball mill and subsequent first gold pour is targeted for SepQ26. Further updates on KEP will be provided with the SepQ25 results, as work towards an optimised project schedule and capex estimate is targeted for early Q2 (flagged in late July on regulatory approval announcement), which may present modest downside risk (we forecast \(\) 130m\(for the mill vs last update of\) \ \(120m\) -

- PT of \(\) 10.50\(/sh PT; retain Neutral. Our FY26 earnings are largely unchanged post incorporating today's result. Our PT rises marginally to\) \ \(10.50 / sh\) as we increase the DCF weighting on our blended valuation to \(60\%\) . We retain our Neutral rating.

Capricorn Metals is a Western Australia- based gold producer and developer. It has two significant long- life, low- cost projects with organic expansion opportunities. The Karlawinda Gold Project (KGP) has been in production since 2021, producing 113koz in FY24, and expansion studies are underway to increase plant throughput to 6.5Mtpa, with targeted production of 150kozpa. The Mt Gibson Gold Project (MGGP) is in the permitting process with PFS highlighting the potential for a 17- year mine life at 150kozpa for the first 15 years of production. We are Neutral based on valuation.
Our Jun- 26 price target is based on a blended DCF \((60\%)\) and EV/EBITDA multiple \((40\%)\) based valuations, rounded to the nearest 25cps. We use a WACC of \(9.2\%\) .

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex- Australia and ex- India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected

total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe.
